intro: Andinia dalstroemii, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered an endangered species.
